titles.title: To redesignate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 11831 Scaggsville Road in Fulton, Maryland, as the "Alfred Rascon Post Office Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Service.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Mr. McHugh moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4430.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on referred to Subcommittee on International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services.

committee.subcommittee: International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services
committee.name: Senate Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: 7/18/2000--Passed House amended. Redesignates the U.S. Postal Service facility located at 8926 Baltimore Street in Savage, Maryland, known as the Savage Post Office, as the Alfred Rascon Post Office Building.
